故事: 在经历了一场漫长炎热的高速公路旅行后，George抵达了Angela的办公室。Angela立即开始谈论一些商业想法。George打断了Angela，说：“唉，我经历了一场漫长而炎热的高速公路旅行。”
问题: 这句话George真正想表达的含义是什么？
选项A: A. George想说他不想听Angela的任何想法
选项B: B. George想让Angela提供一些旅游的建议
选项C: C. George想说，“我能喝点什么吗？”或者“我们在开始谈论业务之前，我能休息几分钟吗？”
选项D: D. George想向Angela抱怨他的旅行
STORY: After experiencing a long and hot highway trip, George arrives at Angela's office. Angela immediately starts to talk about some business ideas. George interrupts Angela, saying, "Ah, I experience a long and hot highway trip."
QUESTION: What is the real meaning George wants to express?
OPTION-A: George wants to say he does not want to listen to any of Angela's ideas
OPTION-B: George wants Angela to provide some travel advice
OPTION-C: George wants to say, "Can I drink something?" or "Can we rest a few minutes before we start talking about business?"
OPTION-D: George wants to complain to Angela about his trip

故事: 在经历了一场漫长炎热的高速公路旅行后，George抵达了Angela的办公室。Angela立即开始谈论一些商业想法。George打断了Angela，说：“唉，我经历了一场漫长而炎热的高速公路旅行。” 然后George又补充说，"我渴了。"
问题: George希望Angela做什么？
选项A: A. Angela提供一份详尽的汇报
选项B: B. Angela给他提供饮料
选项C: C. Angela与他分享更多的商业想法
选项D: D. Angela为他开启空调
STORY: After experiencing a long and hot highway trip, George arrives at Angela's office. Angela immediately starts to talk about some business ideas. George interrupts Angela, saying, "Ah, I experience a long and hot highway trip." Then George adds, "I am thirsty."
QUESTION: What does George hope Angela does?
OPTION-A: Angela provides a detailed report
OPTION-B: Angela gives him a drink
OPTION-C: Angela shares more business ideas with him
OPTION-D: Angela turns on the air conditioning for him

故事: Marissa准备去浴室洗澡。Anna刚刚洗完澡。当Marissa发现浴室很脏时，她叫来Anna，说：“Anna，你找不到清洁剂吗？”
问题: 当Marissa说这句话时，她真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. Anna需要去找清洁剂。
选项B: B. Marissa无法找到清洁剂。
选项C: C. Anna现在应当清洁浴室
选项D: D. Anna应该买更多的清洁剂。
STORY: Marissa prepares to go to the bathroom to take a bath. Anna just finishes taking a bath. When Marissa finds the bathroom is very dirty, she calls Anna and says, "Anna, can't you find the cleaner?"
QUESTION: What does Marissa really want to say when she says this?
OPTION-A: Anna needs to find the cleaner.
OPTION-B: Marissa can't find the cleaner.
OPTION-C: Anna should clean the bathroom now.
OPTION-D: Anna should buy more cleaner.

故事: Marissa准备去浴室洗澡。Anna刚刚洗完澡。当Marissa发现浴室很脏时，她叫来Anna，说：“Anna，你找不到清洁剂吗？” Marissa继续说，“你有时候真的很懒，Anna。”
问题: Marissa希望Anna做什么？
选项A: A. Anna应该去超市买清洁剂。
选项B: B. Anna应当清洁浴室。
选项C: C. Anna应该快点洗澡。
选项D: D. Anna应该改正懒惰的毛病。
STORY: Marissa prepares to go to the bathroom to take a bath. Anna just finishes taking a bath. When Marissa finds the bathroom is very dirty, she calls Anna and says, "Anna, can't you find the cleaner?" Marissa continues, "Sometimes you are really lazy, Anna."
QUESTION: What does Marissa hope Anna does?
OPTION-A: Anna should go to the supermarket to buy cleaner.
OPTION-B: Anna should clean the bathroom.
OPTION-C: Anna should hurry up and take a bath.
OPTION-D: Anna should correct her lazy habits.

故事: 王原和女友分手已经一年了。之后王原历经变故，遭遇失业，他就开始装上滴滴打车软件跑网约车。有一天，他拉上一位女乘客，竟然是前女友。一路上两人相对无语，前女友的表情很挣扎，仿佛在做什么心理准备。到达目的地后，她轻声问王原：“我们还能回去吗？”王原点了一支烟，纠结了半天说：“回去？回去得加二十！”
问题: 当王原说这句话时，他真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 他想表明自己愿意与前女友复合，但前提是增加费用。
选项B: B. 他表达自己愿意将前女友送回打车的地方，前提是增加费用
选项C: C. 他表达了希望前女友理解他目前经济状况的困难。
选项D: D. 他表明自己拒绝前女友复合的请求。
STORY: Wang Yuan breaks up with his girlfriend for a year already. After that, Wang Yuan experiences changes and faces unemployment, so he starts to install the Didi taxi app to run online car-hailing. One day, he picks up a female passenger, who turns out to be his ex-girlfriend. Along the way, the two are silent, the ex-girlfriend's expression struggles, as if she is making some mental preparation. After arriving at the destination, she quietly asks Wang Yuan: "Can we go back?" Wang Yuan lights a cigarette, struggles for a long time and says: "Go back? Going back costs an extra twenty!"
QUESTION: When Wang Yuan says this sentence, what does he really want to say?
OPTION-A: He wants to express his willingness to reconcile with his ex-girlfriend, but the premise is to increase the fee.
OPTION-B: He expresses his willingness to take his ex-girlfriend back to the place where he picks her up, the premise is to increase the fee
OPTION-C: He expresses the hope that his ex-girlfriend understands his current economic difficulties.
OPTION-D: He indicates his refusal to the ex-girlfriend's reconciliation request.

故事: 欧阳是个高中生，他的坐位在班上的最后一排。一天，他的老师陈老师在课上问他：“欧阳，窗外的风景怎么样呢？”
问题: 当陈老师说这句话时，他真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 陈老师担心欧阳坐在最后一排，可能看不清黑板。
选项B: B. 陈老师在提醒欧阳上课不应该东张西望。
选项C: C. 陈老师想知道窗外的风景是什么样子。
选项D: D. 陈老师希望欧阳能够欣赏窗外的风景，感受大自然的美好。
STORY: Ouyang is a high school student, his seat is in the last row of the class. One day, his teacher, Mr. Chen, asks him in class, "Ouyang, how is the scenery outside the window?"
QUESTION: What does Mr. Chen really want to say when he says this?
OPTION-A: Mr. Chen worries that Ouyang, sitting in the last row, may not see the blackboard clearly.
OPTION-B: Mr. Chen reminds Ouyang that he should not look around during class.
OPTION-C: Mr. Chen wants to know what the scenery outside the window looks like.
OPTION-D: Mr. Chen hopes that Ouyang appreciates the scenery outside the window, feeling the beauty of nature.

故事: 在一次晚宴中，顾客小李发现他的蛋糕上有一根头发。于是他叫来了服务员，说：“我不记得我点的蛋糕里有这个配料。”
问题: 当小李说这句话时，他真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 小李喜欢头发作为蛋糕的配料。
选项B: B. 小李认为这是一个玩笑。
选项C: C. 小李希望服务员给他更换一份新的蛋糕。
选项D: D. 小李想知道如何把头发用作蛋糕配料。
STORY: At a dinner party, customer Xiao Li finds a hair on his cake. So he calls the waiter and says, "I don't remember this ingredient in the cake I order."
QUESTION: What does Xiao Li really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: Xiao Li likes hair as an ingredient in the cake.
OPTION-B: Xiao Li thinks this is a joke.
OPTION-C: Xiao Li hopes the waiter gives him a new cake.
OPTION-D: Xiao Li wants to know how to use hair as a cake ingredient.

故事: 有次程伟带儿子逛商场，陪他去儿童游乐场玩，突然看到有个人牵着条狗进来，程伟就问这个人，“没看到这牌子上写着谢绝带宠物入场吗？”对方显得非常不屑，根本没打算理程伟。这个时候，一旁的儿子笑着和程伟说，“爸爸你真傻，狗又不认识字。”
问题: 当儿子说这句话时，他真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 儿子在讽刺这个人没有社会公德。
选项B: B. 儿子正在和他的父亲开玩笑，试图缓和气氛。
选项C: C. 儿子喜欢狗，希望拥有一只
选项D: D. 儿子想告诉爸爸狗无法理解人类的语言。
STORY: Once, Cheng Wei takes his son to the mall and accompanies him to the children's playground. Suddenly, he sees a person leading a dog in. Cheng Wei asks this person, "Don't you see the sign that says no pets are allowed?" The other party appears very disdainful and has no intention of paying attention to Cheng Wei. At this moment, his son laughs and says to Cheng Wei, "Dad, you are so silly, dogs don't know how to read."
QUESTION: What does the son really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: The son is mocking this person for lacking social morality.
OPTION-B: The son is joking with his father, trying to lighten the mood.
OPTION-C: The son likes dogs and hopes to have one.
OPTION-D: The son wants to tell his father that dogs can't understand human language.

故事: Rebecca的生日即将到来。她对父亲说：“我喜欢动物，尤其是狗。”
问题: 当Rebecca说这句话的时候，她真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. Rebecca期待去动物园参观。
选项B: B. Rebecca希望父亲能带她去见狗狗。
选项C: C. Rebecca希望父亲给她购买一只狗作为生日礼物
选项D: D. Rebecca渴望了解动物，特别是狗的生活习性。
STORY: Rebecca's birthday is coming soon. She says to her father, "I like animals, especially dogs."
QUESTION: What does Rebecca really mean when she says this?
OPTION-A: Rebecca looks forward to visiting the zoo.
OPTION-B: Rebecca hopes her father takes her to see dogs.
OPTION-C: Rebecca hopes her father buys her a dog as a birthday gift.
OPTION-D: Rebecca desires to understand the habits of animals, especially dogs.

故事: Rebecca的生日即将到来。她对父亲说：“我喜欢动物，尤其是狗。” Rebecca继续说，“爸爸，我的生日那天宠物店会开吗？”
问题: Rebecca希望她的父亲做什么？
选项A: A. Rebecca希望她的父亲陪她去动物园。
选项B: B. Rebecca希望她的父亲给她讲述关于狗的故事。
选项C: C. Rebecca希望她的父亲给她购买一只狗当做生日礼物。
选项D: D. Rebecca希望她的父亲帮她了解宠物店的营业时间。
STORY: Rebecca's birthday is coming soon. She says to her father, "I like animals, especially dogs." Rebecca continues, "Dad, does the pet store open on my birthday?"
QUESTION: What does Rebecca hope her father does?
OPTION-A: Rebecca hopes her father goes to the zoo with her.
OPTION-B: Rebecca hopes her father tells her a story about dogs.
OPTION-C: Rebecca hopes her father buys her a dog as a birthday gift.
OPTION-D: Rebecca hopes her father helps her understand the opening hours of the pet store.

故事:
三岁的小张和爸爸在逛超市，他们走到卖水果的摊位旁，两人发生如下对话：
“爸，这是啥？”
“香蕉。”
“小孩能吃不？”
问题: 小张说这句话时，真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 小张想要爸爸给他买香蕉。
选项B: B. 小张对水果摊的环境感到好奇。
选项C: C. 小张想知道小孩子能否食用香蕉。
选项D: D. 小张对香蕉的味道感到好奇。
STORY: Three-year-old Little Zhang and his father are shopping in the supermarket. They walk to the fruit stand and the following conversation happens between them: "Dad, what is this?" "Banana." "Can kids eat it?"
QUESTION: What does Little Zhang really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: Little Zhang wants his dad to buy him a banana.
OPTION-B: Little Zhang is curious about the environment of the fruit stand.
OPTION-C: Little Zhang wants to know if children can eat bananas.
OPTION-D: Little Zhang is curious about the taste of bananas.

故事: 在一次同学聚会中，正在大家把酒言欢时，小张对朋友小刘说：“我明天还要早起”。
问题: 小张说这句话时，真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 小张明天早上有重要的事情要处理
选项B: B. 小张喜欢早起做早晨的运动
选项C: C. 小张暗示他现在想要离开了
选项D: D. 小张正在向小刘抱怨自己的忙碌生活
STORY: In a classmate gathering, while everyone is toasting and chatting, Xiao Zhang says to his friend Xiao Liu, "I have to get up early tomorrow."
QUESTION: What does Xiao Zhang really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: Xiao Zhang has important things to deal with tomorrow morning
OPTION-B: Xiao Zhang likes to get up early for morning exercise
OPTION-C: Xiao Zhang hints that he wants to leave now
OPTION-D: Xiao Zhang is complaining to Xiao Liu about his busy life

故事:
鸿杰去银行帮朋友办事，朋友在外地，他找到工作人员要来了办事需要填写的表单，看到了签名那栏，愣住了，因为显示要本人签字。
他很耿直的问工作人员：“我朋友在外地，我可以代签吗？”
工作人员说：“这里有监控，是没法别人代签的，出去找本人签。”
他很着急的说：“我朋友真的回不来，行个方便吧。”
工作人员还是那句话：“这里有监控，别人没法代签，出去找本人签。”
问题: 当工作人员说这句话时，他真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 工作人员是在硬性要求鸿杰必须找他的朋友来银行签字。
选项B: B. 工作人员在暗示鸿杰可以走出银行后帮朋友代签。
选项C: C. 工作人员是再次确认了规定，即银行内不允许他人代签。
选项D: D. 工作人员是在建议鸿杰去找合适的签字工具。
STORY:
Hongjie goes to the bank to help a friend with some business. His friend is out of town. He gets the form that needs to be filled out from the staff and stops when he sees the signature column because it requires the person's own signature.
He asks the staff very straightforwardly: "My friend is out of town, can I sign for him?"
The staff says: "There is surveillance here, it is impossible for others to sign on behalf, go find the person to sign."
He says anxiously: "My friend really can't come back, please make it convenient."
The staff still says: "There is surveillance here, others can't sign on behalf, go find the person to sign."
QUESTION: What does the staff really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: The staff is insisting that Hongjie must find his friend to come to the bank to sign.
OPTION-B: The staff is hinting that Hongjie can sign for his friend after leaving the bank.
OPTION-C: The staff is reconfirming the rule that the bank does not allow others to sign on behalf.
OPTION-D: The staff is suggesting that Hongjie find a suitable signing tool.

故事: 柳州市公安局指挥中心接警员突然接到报警，一女子开口就说：“我要点两份小龙虾外卖，加辣，地址是宛平路367号。记住，一定要记得加辣，我要吃变态辣的。”
问题: 该女子说这句话时，真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 该女子非常饿，想快速订购两份小龙虾外卖。
选项B: B. 该女子表达她对外卖小龙虾的口味的严格要求，即非常喜欢辣的口味。
选项C: C. 该女子可能遭遇了紧急情况，希望获得警察帮助。
选项D: D. 该女子试图给警察局订一份晚餐作为答谢。
STORY: The command center of Liuzhou City Public Security Bureau suddenly receives a police call, a woman starts to say: "I want to order two takeaways of crayfish, extra spicy, the address is 367 Wanping Road. Remember, you must remember to add spice, I want to eat extremely spicy."
QUESTION: What does this woman really mean when she says this sentence?
OPTION-A: The woman is very hungry and wants to quickly order two takeaways of crayfish.
OPTION-B: The woman expresses her strict requirement for the taste of crayfish takeaway, that is, she really likes spicy taste.
OPTION-C: The woman may encounter an emergency situation and hopes to get police help.
OPTION-D: The woman tries to order a dinner for the police station as a thank you.

故事:
一个理科男生每晚都去一个教室自习，每次都坐在一个不认识的女生后面。渐渐地，男生喜欢上了女生，但一直没有勇气表白。舍友们知道后，全都鼓励他。一天晚上，男生终于鼓足了勇气，写了一封表白信，递到女生的手里。
女生看了一会儿之后，收拾学习用具，转身对男生说：我想回去了，你呢？
问题: 当女生说出这句话时，她真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 她表明自己要回家了，询问男生是否也要回家。
选项B: B. 她希望男生可以明白她需要独处。
选项C: C. 她不想和男生在一起。
选项D: D. 她暗示自己同意了男生的表白。
STORY: A science male student goes to a classroom to study every night, always sitting behind a girl he does not know. Gradually, the boy falls in love with the girl, but he never has the courage to confess. When his roommates know, they all encourage him. One night, the boy finally gathers the courage, writes a love letter, and gives it to the girl.\nThe girl looks at it for a while, packs up her study tools, turns around and says to the boy: I want to go back, what about you?
QUESTION: What does she really want to say when the girl says this sentence?
OPTION-A: She indicates that she wants to go home and asks if the boy also wants to go home.
OPTION-B: She hopes the boy understands that she needs to be alone.
OPTION-C: She does not want to be with the boy.
OPTION-D: She implies that she agrees with the boy's confession.

故事: 玛丽是个非常严格的英语教师，她对学生的作文要求非常高。一天，她在批改学生的英语作文时，对其中一名表现不佳的学生黄同学，她说道：“黄同学，你的作文就像启示录一样神秘。”
问题: 当玛丽说这句话的时候，她真正想说的是什么？
选项A: A. 黄同学的作文写得极其冒险
选项B: B. 黄同学的作文写得异常深奥
选项C: C. 黄同学的作文写得十分引人入胜
选项D: D. 黄同学的作文写得含糊不清
STORY: Mary is a very strict English teacher, she has very high requirements for students' essays. One day, she is correcting students' English essays, and she says to a student named Huang who is not performing well, "Huang, your essay is as mysterious as the revelation."
QUESTION: What does Mary really mean when she says this?
OPTION-A: Huang's essay is extremely adventurous
OPTION-B: Huang's essay is exceptionally profound
OPTION-C: Huang's essay is very engaging
OPTION-D: Huang's essay is vague

故事: 最近小华从外国回来参加了一场宴会，在餐桌上，主办方自带了许多茅台酒。开场后不久，小华的朋友，品酒经验丰富的小张喝了一口桌上的茅台酒，说了一句：“茅台就是不一样啊，味道好。”，随后找了个借口换喝了红酒。
问题: 小张说这句话时，他真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 小张喜欢喝红酒，不喜欢茅台酒
选项B: B. 小张认为茅台酒的品质优于红酒
选项C: C. 小张暗示主办方的茅台酒可能不是真的
选项D: D. 小张认为这个宴会的酒品种应该更多样
STORY: Recently, Xiaohua comes back from abroad and attends a banquet. At the table, the host brings a lot of Maotai liquor. Not long after the start, Xiaohua's friend, the experienced wine taster Xiaozhang, takes a sip of the Maotai on the table and says, "Maotai is different, it tastes good.", then finds an excuse to switch to red wine.
QUESTION: What does Xiaozhang really mean when he says this?
OPTION-A: Xiaozhang likes to drink red wine, not Maotai
OPTION-B: Xiaozhang thinks the quality of Maotai is better than red wine
OPTION-C: Xiaozhang hints that the host's Maotai may not be real
OPTION-D: Xiaozhang thinks the variety of wines at this banquet should be more diverse

故事: 一天，校长在改完作业后发现同学们的成绩都不太好，于是在学校教师的微信群里写道：“老师们，我今天看了同学们的作业，真没想到他们这么谦虚，没有一个人全做对。”
问题: 校长说这句话的时候，真正的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 校长认为学生们都很谦虚
选项B: B. 校长在提醒老师们注意改进教学方法
选项C: C. 校长在重视和关注学生的作业
选项D: D. 校长感到遗憾，因为没有人能做对所有的作业
STORY: One day, the principal, after correcting the homework, finds that the students' grades are not very good, so he writes in the WeChat group of school teachers: "Teachers, I look at the students' homework today, I really don't think they are so modest, no one does it all right."
QUESTION: What is the real meaning when the principal says this?
OPTION-A: The principal thinks the students are very modest
OPTION-B: The principal is reminding teachers to pay attention to improving teaching methods
OPTION-C: The principal pays attention to and cares about students' homework
OPTION-D: The principal feels regret because no one can do all the homework right

故事: 李明是一个小学五年级的学生，最近喜欢上了一个流行的电子游戏。由于游戏太过迷人，他每天花费很多时间在这款游戏上。一天，妈妈对正在玩游戏的李明说：“你的游戏水平最近突飞猛进嘛。”
问题: 妈妈说这些话时，她真正想说的意思是什么？
选项A: A. 妈妈非常喜欢看李明玩游戏。
选项B: B. 妈妈想让李明教她怎么玩这款游戏。
选项C: C. 妈妈对李明游戏水平的提升感到欣喜。
选项D: D. 妈妈暗示李明最近花费太多时间在游戏上了。
STORY: Li Ming is a fifth-grade elementary school student who recently falls in love with a popular electronic game. Because the game is too captivating, he spends a lot of time on this game every day. One day, his mother says to Li Ming who is playing the game, "Your game level improves rapidly recently."
QUESTION: What does she really mean when she says these words?
OPTION-A: Mother really enjoys watching Li Ming play games.
OPTION-B: Mother wants Li Ming to teach her how to play this game.
OPTION-C: Mother feels happy about the improvement of Li Ming's game level.
OPTION-D: Mother hints that Li Ming spends too much time on the game recently.

故事: 刚刚入职的小王和老科长一起在疫情管控点站岗，站岗任务不繁重，但老科长站半天感觉很累。不巧的是管控点设备简陋，只有一个凳子。老科长对小王说“小王同志，你也站半天了，就一个凳子，你坐一会儿吧”
问题: 老科长说这句话时，他真正的意图是什么？
选项A: A. 老科长希望小王将凳子让给他坐。
选项B: B. 老科长是在关心小王的健康，希望小王坐下休息。
选项C: C. 老科长想要把坐着的时间让给小王，自己选择站着。
选项D: D. 老科长希望引发关于工作设备状况的对话。
STORY: Newly joined Xiao Wang and the old section chief stand guard together at the epidemic control point. The guard duty is not heavy, but the old section chief feels very tired after standing for half a day. Unfortunately, the equipment at the control point is simple, there is only one stool. The old section chief says to Xiao Wang, "Comrade Xiao Wang, you also stand for half a day, there is only one stool, you sit for a while."
QUESTION: What is the real intention of the old section chief when he says this?
OPTION-A: The old section chief hopes Xiao Wang gives him the stool to sit.
OPTION-B: The old section chief cares about Xiao Wang's health and hopes Xiao Wang sits down to rest.
OPTION-C: The old section chief wants to give the sitting time to Xiao Wang and chooses to stand himself.
OPTION-D: The old section chief hopes to initiate a conversation about the condition of the work equipment.
